Package org.sbrubbles.genericcons

Class Types

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbrubbles.genericcons.Types
  • public final class Types
extends Object
    A namespace for general type utilities, such as cons extraction and type checking. This class is not intended to be instantiated or inherited from.
    Author:
    Humberto Anjos
    See Also:
    C

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public static boolean check​(Type type,
                            Object object)
        Checks if the object's runtime type is compatible with the given type. Null types match nothing.

        Neither will primitive types (such as int.class), since Java's autoboxing will convert object to the equivalent reference type (such as Integer).

        Parameters:
        type - a type.
        object - an object.
        Returns:
        if the object's runtime type is compatible with the given type.

      • check

        public static boolean check​(Iterable<? extends Type> types,
                            Iterable<?> objects)
        Checks if the given objects are compatible with the types held by this instance.
        Parameters:
        types - the given types to check against.
        objects - the given objects to check.
        Returns:
        if the given objects are compatible with the given types.

      • fromSuperclass

        public static List<? extends Type> fromSuperclass​(Class<?> baseClass,
                                                  int parameterIndex)
                                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Java's erasure puts several limitations on capturing type data. Type tokens are a way around that, but require that type captures be made from a subclass before the information is gone.

        Therefore, this method searches baseClass's superclass for the list of types indexed by parameterIndex.

        Examples:

        Generic SuperclassIndexOutput
        Map<String, Integer>0[String]
        Map<String, Integer>1[Integer]
        Map<String, C<Number, Integer>>1[Number, Integer]
        Map<String, C<Object, C<Number, Integer>>>0[String]
        Map<String, C<Object, C<Number, Integer>>>1[Object, Number, Integer]
        Map<String, C<Object, C<Number, Integer>>>2error: IllegalArgumentException!
        Object0error: IllegalArgumentException!
        Parameters:
        baseClass - the class whose generic superclass holds the list of type arguments.
        parameterIndex - where in the given base class' generic superclass' type argument list is the desired list of types.
        Returns:
        a list of the types found.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given base class is null or no type parameters are found.

      • fromCons

        public static List<? extends Type> fromCons​(Type type)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Reads the given type as a cons structure and returns the list of types represented therein.

        Examples:

        InputOutput
        String[String]
        C<String, Number>[String, Number]
        C<String, C<Number, Object>>[String, Number, Object]
        C<String, C<Number, C<Object, List<Double>>>[String, Number, Object, List<Double>]
        nullerror: IllegalArgumentException!
        Parameters:
        type - a type.
        Returns:
        a list of the types represented by the given type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given type is null.
